episodeTitle: The Ultimate Team Has Formed! Shaking Impel Down!
description: Luffy reluctantly agrees to team up with Crocodile after Ivankov threatens to use knowledge of Crocodile's weakness as leverage. Jinbe volunteers to join the escape team to prevent the war between Whitebeard and the Marines. The group of five uses Crocodile's sand powers to ascend through Impel Down, meeting up with Bentham and the Newkama forces on Level 4, where Crocodile liberates and recruits his former subordinate Mr. 1.

openingSong.title: Kaze wo Sagashite
openingSong.artist: Mari Yaguchi and the Straw Hats

events.title: Ivankov Reveals Knowledge of Crocodile's Weakness
events.description: Emporio Ivankov reveals that he knows a secret weakness from Crocodile's past, which he threatens to use as blackmail to ensure Crocodile's cooperation during the prison break. Crocodile reluctantly agrees to work with Luffy's team under this threat.
events.significance: Establishes a mysterious past connection between Ivankov and Crocodile that remains one of One Piece's enduring mysteries. This leverage is crucial for keeping the dangerous former Warlord in check during the escape.

quotes.text: I know your weakness, Crocodile. You wouldn't want that getting out, would you?
quotes.speaker: Emporio Ivankov
quotes.context: Ivankov threatens Crocodile to ensure his cooperation

events.title: Jinbe Volunteers to Join the Escape Team
events.description: Jinbe requests to join Luffy's escape team, explaining that he wants to prevent the war between Whitebeard and the Marines. He reveals his connection to Ace and his willingness to die a glorious death to save him. Luffy accepts his offer.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of Jinbe's alliance with Luffy, which will eventually lead to him becoming a Straw Hat Pirate. Shows Jinbe's noble character and his loyalty to Ace and Whitebeard.

quotes.text: I want to save Ace as badly as you do, even if it means dying a glorious death!
quotes.speaker: Jinbe
quotes.context: Jinbe explains his motivation to join Luffy's team

events.title: The Ultimate Team Is Formed
events.description: The five-member escape team is officially formed: Luffy, Emporio Ivankov, Inazuma, Crocodile, and Jinbe. This unlikely alliance of a pirate captain, revolutionaries, a former Warlord, and a current Warlord represents an unprecedented gathering of power within Impel Down.
events.significance: Creates one of the most powerful and diverse teams ever assembled in One Piece at this point in the story. This team will shake Impel Down to its core and change the course of the Summit War.

events.title: Jinbe Debuts Karakusagawara Seiken
events.description: Jinbe demonstrates his Fish-Man Karate technique Karakusagawara Seiken (Arabesque Tile True Punch), striking from a distance and sending Impel Down guards flying with a delayed shock wave transmitted through water vapor in the air.
events.significance: First display of Jinbe's formidable Fish-Man Karate abilities, showcasing why he is one of the most powerful fighters in the series and a worthy ally for Luffy.

quotes.speaker: Jinbe
quotes.context: Jinbe uses his signature Fish-Man Karate technique against guards

events.title: Team Reunites with Bentham and Newkama Forces
events.description: The escape team ascends through the levels using Crocodile's sand powers to create passages in the ceiling. They reunite with Bentham (Mr. 2 Bon Kurei) and the Newkama army on Level 5, significantly bolstering their forces.
events.significance: Brings together all the major escapees and their allies, creating a massive prison riot that will overwhelm Impel Down's security.

events.title: Luffy Uses Gomu Gomu no Ame
events.description: During the battle with guards on Level 4, Luffy jumps into the air and unleashes Gomu Gomu no Ame (Rubber Rubber Rain), a rapid-fire spinning punch attack that takes down multiple enemies at once.
events.significance: Demonstrates one of Luffy's crowd-control techniques, useful for dealing with large numbers of weaker opponents.

events.title: Crocodile Recruits Mr. 1 from Level 4
events.description: During the fight on Level 4 (Blazing Hell), Crocodile finds his former subordinate Daz Bonez (Mr. 1) imprisoned in a cell. He offers to free him, and Mr. 1 immediately agrees to rejoin Crocodile, demonstrating his unwavering loyalty.
events.significance: Reunites Crocodile with his most loyal Baroque Works agent, adding another powerful fighter to the escape team and showing that Mr. 1's allegiance to Crocodile remains strong despite their defeat in Alabasta.

quotes.text: Mr. 1, would you like to join me in the New World?
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Crocodile offers to free Mr. 1 from his cell

events.title: Ace Transported Toward Marineford Execution
events.description: In a parallel scene, Portgas D. Ace is shown being transported via Marine warship through the Gates of Justice, heading toward Marineford where his public execution is scheduled. The Marines are preparing for Whitebeard's inevitable attempt to rescue him.
events.significance: Sets up the imminent Marineford War, one of the most significant events in One Piece history. Shows that time is running out for Luffy to reach Ace before the execution.

events.title: Buggy and Mr. 3 Reach Level 2
events.description: Meanwhile, Buggy and Galdino (Mr. 3) continue their own escape attempt, successfully reaching Level 2 of Impel Down. They follow a separate path from Luffy's group but are headed toward the same goal of escaping the prison.
events.significance: Maintains the parallel storyline of Buggy's escape, which will eventually converge with Luffy's team and lead to unexpected consequences.

events.title: Mass Battle on Level 4 Begins
events.description: The combined forces of Luffy's team, Bentham, the Newkama army, and now Crocodile with Mr. 1 engage in a massive battle against Impel Down's guards and Jailer Beasts on Level 4. The prison break escalates to unprecedented levels of chaos.
events.significance: Represents the turning point where the prison break becomes an unstoppable force. Impel Down, previously thought impregnable, is being shaken to its core by this unprecedented alliance.

quotes.text: I know your weakness, Crocodile. You wouldn't want that getting out, would you?
quotes.speaker: Emporio Ivankov

quotes.text: I want to save Ace as badly as you do, even if it means dying a glorious death!
quotes.speaker: Jinbe
quotes.context: Volunteering to join Luffy's escape team

quotes.speaker: Jinbe
quotes.context: Using Fish-Man Karate against Impel Down guards

quotes.text: Mr. 1, would you like to join me in the New World?
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Recruiting his former subordinate from his cell

themes.description: The episode showcases how former enemies can become allies when they share a common goal. Luffy teams up with Crocodile, someone who nearly destroyed Alabasta, because both want to prevent Ace's execution.
themes.symbolism: The formation of the Ultimate Team represents the idea that in desperate times, people must set aside past grievances and work together.

themes.description: Multiple characters demonstrate unwavering loyalty: Jinbe to Whitebeard and Ace, Mr. 1 to Crocodile, and the Newkama to Ivankov. This loyalty drives them to risk their lives in what seems like an impossible mission.
themes.symbolism: The willingness to die for one's beliefs or companions is portrayed as a noble virtue.

themes.description: Ivankov's knowledge of Crocodile's weakness introduces themes of hidden pasts and the power of information. What someone wants to keep secret can be used as a powerful tool.
themes.symbolism: Crocodile's mysterious weakness represents the idea that even the strongest individuals have vulnerabilities.

characterSpotlights.development: Jinbe formally joins Luffy's mission, revealing his connection to Ace and demonstrating his incredible strength through Fish-Man Karate. His noble character and willingness to risk everything for his beliefs are established.
keyActions: Volunteers to join the escape team
Fights alongside Luffy against Impel Down guards
quotes: I want to save Ace as badly as you do, even if it means dying a glorious death!

characterSpotlights.development: Despite his past antagonism toward Luffy, Crocodile is forced to cooperate due to Ivankov's blackmail. He demonstrates his continued leadership and tactical thinking by recruiting Mr. 1 and using his sand powers to create escape routes.
keyActions: Reluctantly agrees to work with Luffy under Ivankov's threat
Creates passages through ceilings using sand powers
quotes: Mr. 1, would you like to join me in the New World?

characterSpotlights.development: Ivankov serves as the glue holding the team together, using knowledge of Crocodile's past to keep him in line while leading the Newkama forces in the prison break.
quotes: I know your weakness, Crocodile. You wouldn't want that getting out, would you?

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy continues his desperate attempt to save Ace, willing to work with anyone including his former enemy Crocodile. His determination inspires others to join his cause.
keyActions: Accepts Crocodile into the team despite reservations
Uses Gomu Gomu no Ame against guards
Leads the charge through Impel Down

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime includes comedic details absent from the manga, such as Bentham accidentally kicking wolves while affected by Ivankov's hormone injections.
A brief scene showing Crocodile being dressed by Ivankov's dancers was added for comedic effect in the anime.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts portions of manga chapters 540-541, titled 'Level 6 Eternal Hell' and 'Luffy vs. Warden Magellan'.
The opening theme 'Kaze wo Sagashite' performed by Mari Yaguchi and the Straw Hats was used from episodes 426-458, covering both the Impel Down and early Marineford arcs.

sources.title: Kaze wo Sagashite | One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Daisuke Gori voiced Jinbe in this episode. He would later be replaced by Katsuhisa Hōki as Jinbe's voice actor after Gori's passing.
The mysterious weakness that Ivankov knows about Crocodile has never been revealed in the series, remaining one of One Piece's enduring mysteries and a popular topic for fan theories.

sources.title: One Piece: Ivankov & Crocodile's Mysterious History

trivia.fact: Episode 443 achieved a TV rating of 12.1%, ranking #3 in its time slot when it originally aired in Japan.
This episode marks an important step in Jinbe's relationship with Luffy, eventually leading to Jinbe officially joining the Straw Hat Pirates as the helmsman in episode 976 (Chapter 976).
